intro: Scorzoneroides montana subsp. melanotricha, commonly known as the dark-haired scorzoneroid, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The subspecies is characterized by its dark, hairy leaves and slender, upright stems. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
